intro: Pharmacum hollrungii, commonly known as the mountain ghostplant, is a rare and elusive member of the Pilostemonaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in early spring. Native to the high-altitude regions of South America, this plant thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its botanical significance lies in its unique adaptations to extreme climates and its potential medicinal properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
